revised_title: Excitation and Propagation of Earth-Ionosphere Waveguide by Downgoing Whistlers
tldr: This article discusses the excitation of the Earth-ionosphere waveguide by downgoing whistlers with wave normals in the magnetic meridian. The author suggests that the wave normal is scattered into the acceptance cone by spread-F irregularities. The article explores reflexion and coupling coefficients, and shows that for some angles of incidence, the signal is trapped in the waveguide. The range in the waveguide is computed as a function of the angle of incidence, and the properties of the waveguide modes are discussed.
